citation.article-title: Paenibacillus xylanisolvens sp. nov., a xylan-degrading bacterium from soil
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Paenibacillus xylanisolvens sp. nov.
Paenibacillus xylanisolvens (xy.la.ni.sol′vens. N.L. n. xylanum xylan; L. part. adj. solvens dissolving; N.L. part. adj. xylanisolvens xylan-dissolving).
Cells are Gram-stain-positive, facultatively anaerobic, motile rods (0.4–0.8×1.5–3.0 μm).
Central or subterminal ellipsoidal endospores are observed in swollen sporangia.
Colonies are 1–5 mm in diameter, circular, flat, white and opaque after 2 days of incubation on C agar medium.
Growth is observed at pH 6–9 (optimally at pH 7–8), at 15–50 °C (optimally at 30–37 °C), in 3 % NaCl (weakly) and under anaerobic conditions, but not at pH 5, at 10, 55 or 60 °C or in 5 % NaCl.

Positive for catalase, oxidase, nitrate reduction, hydrolysis of aesculin (weak), casein, Tween 80, urea and xylan and assimilation of d-glucose, maltose, d-mannitol and d-mannose, but negative for methyl red and Voges–Proskauer reactions, citrate utilization, H2S production, indole production, fermentation of glucose, hydrolysis of l-arginine, DNA, gelatin, p-nitrophenyl β-d-galactopyranoside, starch and l-tyrosine and assimilation of N-acetylglucosamine, l-arabinose, adipic acid, capric acid, phenylacetic acid and potassium gluconate.

Able to produce acid from aesculin, d-arabinose, d-arabitol, d-fructose, α-glucopyranoside, d-galactose, d-glucose, glycerol, d-lyxose, maltose, d-mannitol, d-mannose, d-ribose, sucrose, trehalose, turanose and d-xylose, but not from N-acetylglucosamine, d-adonitol, amygdalin, l-arabinose, l-arabitol, arbutin, cellobiose, dulcitol, erythritol, d- or l-fucose, gentiobiose, gluconate, glycogen, inositol, inulin, 2-ketogluconate, 5-ketogluconate, lactose, α-mannopyranoside, melezitose, melibiose, raffinose, l-rhamnose, salicin, d-sorbitol, l-sorbose, starch, d-tagatose, β-xylopyranoside, xylitol or l-xylose.
The predominant fatty acids are anteiso-C15 : 0 and C16 : 0.
The cell-wall diamino acid is meso-diaminopimelic acid.
Major phospholipids are diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylmonomethylethanolamine, phosphatidylethanolamine and phosphatidylglycerol.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 51.6 mol%.
The type strain is X11-1T (=KCTC 13042T =PCU 311T =TISTR 1829T), isolated from soil.
